org.jpac

Class Handshake

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpac.Handshake

  • public class Handshake
extends java.lang.Object
    implements a handshake mechanism to synchronize two modules which have a producer/consumer relationship

      void reset()
      used by the acknowledging module to reset the handshake for instance in case of a detected protocol error
      void resetAcknowledgement()
      used by the acknowledging module to remove a pending acknowledgement After this call the handshake is idle and can be reused.
      void resetRequest()
      used by the requesting module to remove a pending request to abort it or to respond to a pending acknowledgement The acknowledging module should response by use of resetAcknowledgement()
      void seize(AbstractModule requestingModule)
      used to seize the handshake.
      void setActive()
      used by the acknowledging module to indicate, that the processing of a request has begun

    • Constructor Detail

      • Handshake

        public Handshake(AbstractModule servingModule,
                 java.lang.String identifier)
          throws SignalAlreadyExistsException
        Parameters:
        servingModule - the acknowledging module (consumer)
        identifier - the identifier of this handshake (Corresponds to the identifiers of signals).
        Throws:
        SignalAlreadyExistsException

      • Handshake

        public Handshake(AbstractModule servingModule,
                 AbstractModule requestingModule,
                 java.lang.String identifier)
          throws SignalAlreadyExistsException,
                 WrongUseException
        Parameters:
        servingModule - the acknowledging module (consumer)
        requestingModule - the requesting module (producer)
        identifier - the identifier of this handshake (Corresponds to the identifiers of signals).
        Throws:
        SignalAlreadyExistsException
        WrongUseException

    • Method Detail

      • requested

        public ProcessEvent requested()
        Returns:
        returns a ProcessEvent which is fired, when the handshake is requested. Can be awaited by the acknowledging module

      • requestRemoved

        public ProcessEvent requestRemoved()
        Returns:
        returns a ProcessEvent which is fired, when the a pending request is reset. Can be awaited by the acknowledging module

      • acknowledged

        public ProcessEvent acknowledged()
        Returns:
        returns a ProcessEvent which is fired, when the handshake is acknowledged. Can be awaited by the requesting module

      • acknowledgementRemoved

        public ProcessEvent acknowledgementRemoved()
        Returns:
        returns a ProcessEvent which is fired, when the a pending acknowledgement is reset. Can be awaited by the requesting module

      • active

        public ProcessEvent active()
        Returns:
        returns a ProcessEvent which is fired, when the handshake is acknowledged. Can be awaited by the requesting module

      • request

        public void request()
             throws SignalAccessException,
                    WrongUseException
        used by the requesting module to trigger a request to be handled by the acknowledging module
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException
        WrongUseException

      • resetRequest

        public void resetRequest()
                  throws SignalAccessException,
                         WrongUseException
        used by the requesting module to remove a pending request to abort it or to respond to a pending acknowledgement The acknowledging module should response by use of resetAcknowledgement()
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException
        WrongUseException

        public void setActive()
               throws SignalAccessException
        used by the acknowledging module to indicate, that the processing of a request has begun
        Throws:

      • resetAcknowledgement

        public void resetAcknowledgement()
                          throws SignalAccessException,
                                 WrongUseException
        used by the acknowledging module to remove a pending acknowledgement After this call the handshake is idle and can be reused.
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException
        WrongUseException

      • reset

        public void reset()
           throws SignalAccessException,
                  NumberOutOfRangeException
        used by the acknowledging module to reset the handshake for instance in case of a detected protocol error
        Throws:
        SignalAccessException
        NumberOutOfRangeException

      • isRequested

        public boolean isRequested()
                    throws SignalInvalidException
        Returns:
        returns true, if a request is pending, which is not acknoweldedged yet
        Throws:
        SignalInvalidException

      • isAcknowledged

        public boolean isAcknowledged()
                       throws SignalInvalidException
        Returns:
        returns true, if an acknowledgement is pending
        Throws:
        SignalInvalidException

      • isActive

        public boolean isActive()
                 throws SignalInvalidException
        Returns:
        returns true, if processing is pending
        Throws:
        SignalInvalidException

      • seize

        public void seize(AbstractModule requestingModule)
           throws WrongUseException,
                  SignalAlreadyExistsException
        used to seize the handshake. Can be done by a requesting module to make shure that no other module can make requests over this handshake.
        Parameters:
        requestingModule -
        Throws:
        WrongUseException
        SignalAlreadyExistsException
